user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_update:
```c
_MHD_static_inline void
digest_update (struct DigestAlgorithm *da,
               const void *data,
               size_t length)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->uninitialised);
  mhd_assert (da->algo_selected);
  mhd_assert (da->ready_for_hashing);
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5 == da->algo)
    MHD_MD5_update (&da->ctx.md5_ctx, (const uint8_t *) data, length);
  else
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256 == da->algo)
    MHD_SHA256_update (&da->ctx.sha256_ctx, (const uint8_t *) data, length);
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256 == da->algo)
    MHD_SHA512_256_update (&da->ctx.sha512_256_ctx,
                           (const uint8_t *) data, length);
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
  mhd_assert (0);   /* May not happen */
#ifdef _DEBUG
  da->hashing = true;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#ifdef _DEBUG
  da->hashing = true;
#endif
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Generally no — the assignment is reachable in normal configurations because it follows the chained if/else and will execute when one of the update branches is taken. is_rule_violated is false. However, a specific build configuration can make it unreachable: if none of MHD_MD5_SUPPORT, MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT and MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT are defined, the preprocessor leaves a lone mhd_assert(0); and if mhd_assert expands to a non‑returning abort (common in debug builds), the subsequent da->hashing = true; (even though guarded by _DEBUG) can never be reached in that build — that would violate Rule 2.1 in that configuration.
